{{ardayearheader|185|210|217|220|Seventh Age 1|Seventh Age 869|Seventh Age 878}}

* Some "secret societies" emerge in [[Gondor]] "practising [[Dark Tree|dark cults]], and '[[Orcs|orc-cults]]' among adolescents".<ref name="letter">{{L|338}}</ref>
* This "secret [[Morgoth|Satanistic]] religion" is later discovered and overthrown in Gondor.<ref>{{L|256}}</ref>
* About this time, [[Eldarion|Eldarion's]] reign as [[High King (Dúnedain)|High King]] comes to an end.<ref name="letter"/>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In ''[[The New Shadow]]'', there is only one single [[Dark Tree|dark cult]] that arose in [[Gondor]]. It is connected to the term [[Herumor (The New Shadow)|Herumor]]. Before the events of the narrative, it is mentioned that a few Shipmen and a small vessel of the [[King's Ships]] mysteriously disappeared.<ref name="Shadow">{{PM|Shadow}} pp. 419 - 420, Note 7</ref>

In [[April]], [[Berelach]] visited his father [[Borlas]] at [[Pen-arduin]], telling him about the recent incident with the Shipmen, believing that they were unskilled and foolish; and as such, deserved their fate.<ref name="Shadow"/>

In [[June]], Borlas quoted Berelach's tale to [[Saelon]], only for Saelon to put suspicion on Berelach's story, leading to a discussion about the nature of evil.<ref name="Shadow"/>

Since the events of ''The New Shadow'' is described taking place during the reign of Eldarion and "after the death of [[Aragorn|Elessar]]", this dating contradicts to the second edition of ''The Lord of the Rings'', where in [[Appendix B]] the date of Aragorn's death was ultimately changed by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] from {{FoA|100}} to {{FoA|120}}.

The text from which the date of Eldarion's death as the year 125 derives was written by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in [[1959]]<ref>{{NM|P1xi}}, p. 78</ref> and thus predates the second edition of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', where Tolkien ultimately changed the date of [[Aragorn|Aragorn's]] death from {{FoA|100}} to {{FoA|120}}.
